    2. Filesystems
      for vg in datavg01 datavg02 datavg03 datavg04 datavg05 datavg06
do
   echo "Printing filesystems on ${vg} "
   lsvgfs ${vg} | xargs -n1 df -k | grep -v ^File
done

  2. Dismount all filesystems - FTA
    for fs in $(echo " datavg01 datavg02 datavg03 datavg04 datavg05 datavg06" | xargs -n1 lsvgfs | sort -r )
do
   echo "Dismounting ${fs} "
   sudo umount ${fs}
done

  3. Rename all FTA Original filesystems with a unique prefix
    for vg in datavg01 datavg02 datavg03 datavg04 datavg05 datavg06
do
   for fs in $(lsvgfs ${vg} )
   do
      echo "Renaming ${fs} to /FTAORIG${fs}"
      sudo chfs -m /FTAORIG${fs} ${fs}
   done
done

Storage team presents copy of PTA data file systems to FTA

Recreate vg's mount file systems of PTA on QAERDB01

  1. Take a current device map
    sudo lsvpcfg.sh > lsvpcfg.out.1
  2. Discover devices
    sudo cfgmgr
  3. Take a current device map
    sudo lsvpcfg.sh > lsvpcfg.out.2
  4. Check the new devices and Store the new devices to a file
    diff lsvpcfg.out.1 lsvpcfg.out.2 | grep hdisk | sed "s;> ;;g" > newdevices
  5. Take a LVM map from production
    ssh paerdb99 "lspv -u" > paerdb99.lspv-u
  6. CLear PVIDs on the devices we just copied just in case
    cat newdevices | grep vg |  awk -F: '{print $1}' | xargs -n1 sudo chdev -a pv=clear -l
  7. Execute recreatevg on all the copied volume groups
    for vg in datavg01 datavg02 datavg03 datavg04 datavg05 datavg06
do
   echo "Re-creating ${vg} as fta${vg} "
   grep -w ${vg} paerdb99.lspv-u | awk '{print $2}' > ${vg}.pvids
   disks=$(grep -f ${vg}.pvids newdevices | awk -F: '{print $1}' | tr "\n" " " )
   sudo recreatevg -O -y fta${vg} -Yfta  ${disks}
done
  8. Rename filesystems from PTA to FTA
    for fs in $(echo "ftadatavg01 ftadatavg02 ftadatavg03 ftadatavg04 ftadatavg05 ftadatavg06" | xargs -n1 lsvgfs | sort )
do
  newfs=$(echo ${fs} | sed "s/PTA/FTA/g")
  sudo chfs -m ${newfs} ${fs}
done
    for fs in $(echo "ftadatavg01 ftadatavg02 ftadatavg03 ftadatavg04 ftadatavg05 ftadatavg06" | xargs -n1 lsvgfs | sort )
do
  newfs=$(echo ${fs} | sed "s;/fs;;g")
  sudo chfs -m ${newfs} ${fs}
done
  9. Repairing and Mount Filesystems
    for fs in $(echo "ftadatavg01 ftadatavg02 ftadatavg03 ftadatavg04 ftadatavg05 ftadatavg06" | xargs -n1 lsvgfs | sort )
do
   echo "Repairing and mounting filesystem - ${fs}"
   sudo fsck -y ${fs}
   sudo mkdir -p ${fs}
   sudo mount ${fs}
   echo ""
   echo ""
done
  1. Hand over the system to DBA team
